channel.title: Cathy McMorris Rodgers
channel.description: Remarks of Cathy McMorris Rodgers to the Republican National Convention, Tampa, August 2012

item.title: Ladies and gentleman, welcome to the final evening of the 2012 National Convention
We have had a wonderful few days, hearing the inspiring stories of Republicans from across the country
From some of our party's great leaders like Governor Jeb Bush, who we just heard from, to every day men and women working hard to survive in the Obama economy, they've told us how we can do better
They've reminded us that we built it, and we learned about how under the Romney-Ryan administration we can change it
Of course, tonight is the main event
Tonight we will hear from the next president of the United States, Mitt Romney
And we have chosen him because we believe in America
We believe in an America that doesn't punish success, but celebrates it
An America that encourages hard work and individual responsibility
And we believe in an America where every child has the chance to succeed
Tonight we'll hear from some of the people who know Mitt Romney best
In their words and from their stories we will learn why he is the right man to defeat Barack Obama this November, and restore America to greatness
We'll hear from dear family friends whose lives have been touched by the Romneys' faith and generosity
We'll hear from two former colleagues who worked alongside Mitt when he was Governor of Massachusetts
You'll hear from the CEO of Staples, a successful company that Mitt Romney helped create and expand during his time at Bain Capital
We're delighted to have a number of former Olympians with us tonight, to remind us of the great comeback that Mitt Romney engineered at the Salt Lake City Olympics
And we are excited that Florida Senator Marco Rubio is here to share his personal story and vision for a future where everyone can still capture the American dream
To get the next portion of our evening started, I would like to welcome to the stage, Grant Bennett, President of CPS Technologies and friend of Mitt Romney.
